history.content:
Hey I’m taking cs186 + ee126 + phys7b right now so I think i can speak about this. In my opinion:

186: yep, the projects are quite difficult. They took me around 10hrs per part/assignment. Lack of hw really otherwise makes up for that though. You need to start early on the projs. Otherwise, content is on the easier side for an UD eecs class.
126: probably the hardest eecs class I’ve ever taken. People in this class are amazing smart. Psets (+lab) can take 5-10hrs a week depending on how much you utilize OH and get the concepts 
7b: this class isn’t too bad, ~2hrs of hw a week. You’ll need to put in the effort to learn the stuff and study of course, but I definitely didn’t study as hard for this compared to other classes and am doing fine.

I’ve always taken 3 techs per semester so this schedule wasn’t really anything out of my comfort zone. So in ramping up from 2 to 3 you may find yourself neglecting physics. But I think it’s doable.

(Fall 2020) Does anyone have any experience/thoughts about the workload of 7B/126/186? I’ve heard 186 is pretty heavy project-wise and I struggle a fair amount with probability, so I have a feeling 186/126 will take a lot of my time. I prefer to take 2 techs per semester, but I need to take 7B eventually. The semester I take it will inevitably have 3 techs, I’m just not sure if this will be the right semester to do it. (For reference I will also most likely be taking an upper-div humanities course/involved in CSM in some capacity.) Thanks!
history.subject: Physics 7B/EECS 126/CS 186 workload?
